de.bpmnaftool.model.bpmn.flowobject
Interface Event

All Superinterfaces:
FlowObject
All Known Implementing Classes:
EventImpl
public interface Event
extends FlowObject

An Event is a FlowObject which can be triggered for various reasons (see trigger attribute). Every pool starts and ends with an event, but events can also occur in between (see type attribute).

Author:
Felix Härer

Nested Class Summary
static class Event.Trigger
          Defines how the event is triggered.
static class Event.Type
          Type of the event.

Methods inherited from interface de.bpmnaftool.model.bpmn.flowobject.FlowObject
getId, getLane, getName, setId, setName
 

Method Detail

getType

Event.Type getType()
Returns the type of this event. A StartEvent is the event of a pool, an EndEvent is the last. Events in between are called IntermediateEvents.

Returns:
type of this event

getTrigger

Event.Trigger getTrigger()
Returns how the event is triggered, e.g. through a Message or a Timer.

Returns:
trigger of this event

isThrowingEvent

java.lang.Boolean isThrowingEvent()
Returns if an event is throwing. E.g. a message event is throwing if it sends messages and catching if it receives messages. Null if undefined.

Returns:
true, if the event is throwing, false if the event is catching, null if undefined.

setThrowingEvent

void setThrowingEvent()
Sets this event to a throwing event. E.g. a message event is throwing if it sends messages and catching if it receives messages.

setCatchingEvent

void setCatchingEvent()
Sets this event to a catching event. E.g. a message event is throwing if it sends messages and catching if it receives messages.
